intro: Charachera spicata, commonly known as the spiked charachera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Charachera spicata is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
